step.context: \text{Would the following choice of $f(x)$ and $f'(x)$} \\ \text{work to fit $\int e^x( \sin x + \cos x)dx$ into this} \\ \text{standard result }\\ \int e^x[f(x) + f'(x)] dx = e^x\cdot f(x) + C?
step.tex: f(x)=\sin x, f'(x)=\cos x \\ \therefore I = \int e^x[\sin x + \cos x] dx = e^x \,\sin x + C
f(x)=\cos x, f'(x)=\sin x \\ \therefore I = \int e^x[\cos x + \sin x] dx = e^x \,\cos x + C
step.reason: e^x ( \sin x + \cos x) \text{ matches the form } \\ e^x [\, f(x) + f'(x)\, ] \text{ only if }f(x) = \sin x \\ \text{Remember }\dfrac{d}{dx} \cos x = -\sin x
